metadata.name: Suspicious MacOS Firmware Activity
metadata.comment: Detects when a user manipulates with Firmward Password on MacOS. NOTE - this command has been disabled on silicon-based apple computers.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND lower(process.name) = lower('/usr/sbin/firmwarepasswd') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('setpasswd')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('full')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('delete')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('check'))))

output.summary: Detects when a user manipulates with Firmward Password on MacOS. NOTE - this command has been disabled on silicon-based apple computers.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities References: https://github.com/usnistgov/macos_security/blob/932a51f3e819dd3e02ebfcf3ef433cfffafbe28b/rules/os/os_firmware_password_require.yaml, https://www.manpagez.com/man/8/firmwarepasswd/, https://support.apple.com/guide/security/firmware-password-protection-sec28382c9ca/web
